result.execSummary:
The defendant Lucas M. Wille was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Dwelling, Boat or Motor Home, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(e).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.   Absolute Sobriety.  ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS WITHIN 60 DAYS OR SET UP PAYMENT ARRANGEMENTS.

If extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Defendant Lucas M. Wille appeared by video means from LEC w/atty. Tom Steinman. Prosecuting Atty Kevin R. Calkins appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  DE does qualify for PD representation. State requests $5000.00 Cash bond. Atty. Steinman makes bail argument, no bail jumps, 14CF228 on cash bond, no missing court dates, requests signature bond.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits  waived.  $5000.00 Cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: No contact w/J.R. or his residence.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 22, 2014 at 11:00 am.  Return date scheduled for September 3, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
